Reviews.Content: Good Hotel We arrived before our check-in time and our room was ready. We requested for a smoking room which was not done at the time of booking. The staff quickly gave us a smoking room. The staff was always cheerful and willing to help. There was a complementary newspaper every day. On the whole it was a good economical place to stay with a convenient metro station nearby and decent cafes close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Simran27

Reviews.Content: Hit  Stayed in City Park for a couple of nights before joining a cruise.Reception and restaurant staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast OK - nothing special.Location is very close to Sants Metro Station - 15 minutes or so into central Barcelona. Had some difficulty one night getting back to hotel as taxi driver didn't know where it was but he dropped us off at the Metro station.Speaking to other guests, rooms are very variable in quality. Our room (515) was very small with double bed pushed into corner of room to create space to move around room - bathroom was almost as large! Window looking onto concrete wall. Wallpaper peeling off and carpets grubby. Other guests had larger rooms although those at front were woken by refuse collectors in middle of night.
Reviews.Author: Hallix

Reviews.Content: Clean, Friendly Service, Close to Metro and Trains. I've just returned home from a 7 nights stay at the City Park Hotel in Barcelona and absolutely loved it. The staff was very helpful and were always in a good mood. The lady at reception provided me with a few guides to Barcelona which proved to be very useful for my visit. The hotel is very clean and quiet, so I had no problem falling asleep after a day of sightseeing. The breakfast is fresh and there is so much variety that I think it caters for most tastes. The room was clean and the bed was firm, but very comfortable. The only thing about it that I didn't like was the smell of cigarette smoke on the fifth floor, where my room was. It seems to be ingrained in the curtains and carpets. The Hotel is situated just around the corner from the Sants metro station which will take you straight into the centre of town (Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas). It is also about 5 mins walk from the Sants Estacio train station, where you can get on a train to Sitges, or Madrid or to the neighbouring countries. I would definitley go back there.
Reviews.Author: MartinR_8

Reviews.Content: More than a 3*, not a 4* though We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in feb and had a pleasant stay.It is very close to the metro station which is really easy to use and good value for money but there is little else in the area.Breakfast was very good with a good selection for a foreign hotel.The rooms were ok, the hotel is now totally non smoking. Beds were as hard as bullets and lighting was bad in the room but it was clean and was only a base as you were doing lots of sightseeing.Overall it is a good base and good if you don't mind catching the underground. It is also very close to the main railways station which is ideal when coming from the airport, just as easy as getting a taxi.
Reviews.Author: ell1e

Reviews.Content: Great hotel The City Park is just a great hotel. Very nice, clean and spacious room, great bath, great breakfast. The location is also great: near the Sants Staci贸 station, and can get the subway and also trains to Madrid from there. Is stays just about a two blocks walking distance from the hotel. The staff was very kind and the price was very reasonable. Great choice at all.
Reviews.Author: Maximus80

Reviews.Content: great hotel Arrived at the hotel having had my purse stolen on stepping off the airport bus in Playa Catalunya - beware of theft it is rife in Barcelona. Several people on the same flight lost purses and handbags in the City. The guy on the reception desk named Gandi couldnt have done enough for me and helped me cancel my credit card instantly. The staff were very helpful, the room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was luxurious. There was just about everything provided in the bathroom that you could think of - bath gel, shampoo, toothbrushes and toothpaste, razor, tissues, combs, shoe shine kit .... I had read another review so knew there was no tea/coffee making facilities so I packed the travel kettle - no hastle. There is a supermarket just around the corner from the hotel.The free soft drink mini bar is just on day of arrival - 3 small bottles of pop. Handy to keep drinks cool though. The metro is approx 3 mins stroll from the hotel and the Sants station 5 mins stroll. The bus touristic can be found at the bus station right beside Sants so everything is really handy. 30 min train journey to Sitges - highly recommended and the train is free! Taxi back to the airport costs 28 euros.Jan Belfast
Reviews.Author: garfieldBelfast

Reviews.Content: Whats the fuss I got to say after reading reviews on this hotel I was somewhat apprehensive,alas without just cause.Arrived with my wife to find a very modern and clean hotel,and was efficiently checked in by staff. Room was clean and tidy and had all you would need with exception of tea/coffee machine ,but a free soft drinks mini bar instead so no prob there.Breakfast was a good mixture of toasts,rolls,cereals,fruits,and small hot selection.Plenty of fruits juices and hot drinks.Staff were pleasant and helpful.For those who complained of the location being over 30 min from centre must of got lost.Metro is 2 min at most from hotel and takes 12 min to Ramblas.get Metro to Drassanes for best location for places of interest.This is a centre position for the modern Port Vell area and La Rambla the other way.If to come to Barcelona again I will stick with what I know and book the City park again
Reviews.Author: nickjs

Reviews.Content: Was Ment to stay hear and when we got there they had lost our reservation Well we arrived in the lobby after a very early flight in the morning tiered and a little agitated to be told that there is a problem with our booking and was told to get in a taxi to one of there other hotels City Park Pelayo Hotel Barcelona which is a 2* property when we had paid for a 4* property reading the reviews we proberly had a lucky escape as this hotel was just a few min away from the heart of everything and the night life as well as the shopping
Reviews.Author: Lambo1982

Reviews.Content: disapointment Hotel is very well presented and at first glance looks impressive.Is situated too far from centre of barcelona and is a 30 min tram ride then 30 min on the underground.There are no shops near by and no bars or resturants.I would not recommend you eat in the resturant.We ordered chicken and chips and the chicken was red inside.If we had eaten it i have no doubt we would have got food poisoning,we refused to eat it but were still billed.We found the head waiter very unreasonable and intimadating.On the last day we asked for a wake up call,they did not call us and as a result we almost missed our flight.We found that the customer service was very poor,i feel tat they do not like catering for the english but if your spanish youl have no problems.We were extremly disappointed.
Reviews.Author: sabrina37

Reviews.Content: Could be good ..... but it's not! This hotel is situated in a quiet part of the city a mere few minutes walk from Sants Estacio metro which has good links to all the main points of interest.Our stay got off to a disappointing start in that my friend and I had booked a twin room prior to arriving and were told that a large group had arrived shortly before us and we had to stay either in separate single rooms or share a double (unless we wanted to trek to a hotel near the airport). This was annoying in that we'd organised all of this prior to our arrival. As friends on a city break together we wanted to be sociable and share a room but wanted to sleep in our own bed! The single rooms we were shown were incredibly small and felt very claustrophobic. We eventually stayed in a double room which was much roomier but didn't find the hotel reception staff particularly accommodating or friendly in this respect. All of the rooms are painted in a grey colour and this combined with mood lighting makes for a dark and somewhat sombre environment.The sheets on the bed were stained - yuck! These were changed when we asked. The breakfast was particularly disappointing ..... as it was Easter weekend the hotel was full but the hotel was just not prepared for this in respect to breakfast. On one morning we had to queue for about ten minutes just to get into the dining area .... there weren't many tables but many of them were for four people. They would definitely benefit from having more tables for two people. The scrambled egg was inedible .... tasted like some kind of powdered concoction, the bacon wasn't exactly pleasant either. The two waiting staff on each morning struggled to keep on top of things (they needed more staff on a bank holiday weekend) and tables were often not cleared or cleaned properly before you sat down.One of the roller blinds in our room was totally broken and could not be wound up .... this was really annoying as the room was so dark anyway. For 拢100 per night this lack of attention to detail was very disappointing.Many places and restaurants/shops were closed on bank holidays (especially in this hotel's vicinity) and the hotel had very limited room service (that didn't even start until 8 pm) and no snacks etc that could be purchased. It would have been helpful if we'd been made aware of this at the time of booking,It could be a good hotel but for all the reasons above it wasn't in my opinion. It was a pretty disappointing use of my hard earned cash! But Barcelona was great and well worth visiting .....
Reviews.Author: FionaBrighton

Reviews.Content: Ideal location Just come back from a weekend in Barcelona and stayed 2 nights at the City Park Hotel. Lovely hotel, staff were ok, not over friendly but answered any questions we had. Room was very clean but the curtains didn't close fully and it was very noisy due to other GUESTS so we asked to move rooms, which we did and that was ok. Breakfast was usual selection, nice start to a day's sightseeing. Metro just round corner and tourist bus stops, couldn't fault the public transport great value for money.Only bad point was that it had no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but did have free soft drinks in mini fridge. Over all it was a pleasant stay.
Reviews.Author: HayzHerts

Reviews.Content: City Park hotel is great The City Park hotel is an excellent hotel to stay in if you are visitng Barcelona. It is very clean and modern looking and the rooms are a good size and our room overlooked a small park next to the hotel which is situated in a fairly quiet area of the City. It does live upto its 4 star standard.The hotel very obviously caterers for business conferences and this added to the quality of the hotel.In terms of the price we paid for 3 nights accomodation it was incredibly cheap (although it was January) but i doubt we'd have got better value anywhere else.The staff are the most friendly and welcoming people that i have ever met in any hotel that i have stayed in before, they couldnt do enough to help us.We had the buffet breakfast each day and it was the ideal way to set us up for a days sightseeing.In terms of location it is just 50 metres to the nearest underground station (which is by far the best way to get around the city and it is cheap as well). As part of this underground station is 'Sants Estatio' which is one of Barcelonas main train stations and it cost just 2euro50 to get to the airport.City Park is just 15mins walk from the Nou Camp football stadium.Taxis to the main city centre (Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla)from the hotel cost in the region of 5-10 euros depending if you get stuck in traffic or not, but take the underground if you can.Plaza Espanya was also about a 15minute walk.If i was being extremely fussy i did expect coffee/tea making facilities in the room although the minibar compensated for this with some complimentary non-alcoholic drinks on arrival.Not that you would have a night-in, in Barcelona but there wasnt much going on at the hotel at night, but like most people we just used the hotel as a place to sleep between enjoying such a magnificant city.I would not hesitate in staying at the City Park hotel again if i were to re-visit Barcelona, even if it was just to meet the staff again
Reviews.Author: IvanCampo

Reviews.Content: nice place we stayed for 3 nightswe had a very good breakfast and plenty of choice, the staff were freindly, the rooms were very nice, free soft drinks in the mini bar and a very nice welcome pack in the bathroom. its in a good position for all areas of barcelonawould stay again, its a good place to watch the world and there dogs.
Reviews.Author: mello72

Reviews.Content: Great hotel and goodish area. Great hotel, great staff. 15mins walk from the palace area and 5mins from a very major station (sants). Watch out for the maids a knife disappeared from my room one day and I have heard of this on another review site.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: City Park Hotel, Sant Just Desvern, Barcelona The new City Park Hotel is located in the suburbs of Barcelona, in Sant Just Desvern. It is really wonderful located along highways and at the main traffic connection in and out Barcelona Center: a 4 or 6 lane street, called Diagonal. The hotel is worth every of it's 4 stars. Rooms are clean and very beautiful. Beds are big and comfortable. Ample parking on private grounds. Breakfast is a buffet with a good range of food. The only disadvantage might be that, as everywhere in Spain, smoking is culture, and non-smokers will hardly find a non-smoking environment. This is especially annoying in the breakfast room. We strongly recommend this beautiful hotel when your destination is Barcelona, and you have a car available.
Reviews.Author: MK2002

Reviews.Content: Nice Staff and quiet location. Quiet location and nice hotel. The best was the helpful staff. Great choice out of the noisy city center.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a fair location We were bumped from our reserved hotel due to overbooking and sent to the City Park. It is a modern property that is somewhat worn but adequate overall. The front desk staff varied from extremely helpful to not quite indifferent, but perhaps not quite understanding. The breakfast buffet was out of most items more than an hour before it was scheduled to close and the remaining food was cold and dried out. It is located in a so -so neighborhood near a large prison and an overpass. The adjacent park is mostly concrete with a lot of graffiti. It is not within reasonable walking distance from the center but the Sants Station with rail, bus and Metro connections is very close with 10 minute connections to the Ramblas. There is not much else in the vicinity and I would not be completely comfortable walking about at night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
